page.title: 05THE RAILWAY STATION
page.content: The passenger train service through Worksop operates between Lincoln and Sheffield. The booking office is open at 7.15am. until 6.00pm. Passengers pay on the train if they travel after these times. A warning bell rings at the station when a train is due. Two rings signal a train from Retford and one ring signals a train from Sheffield. At the station there are three people in the booking office, three porters, two men to light the lamps and one man in the goods yard. Three men operate the level crossing in eight hour shifts. The crossing closes about 100 times a day, mostly for coal trains. The signalman called this a 'merry-go-round'.
